current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
Supporting the goals and ideals of National
		  Safe Digging Month.

cosponsor.#tail:
)) submitted the following resolution;
			 which was considered and agreed to

text.#text:
supports the
			 goals and ideals of National Safe Digging Month; and

encourages all
			 homeowners and excavators throughout the United States to call 811 before
			 digging.

Whereas each year, the underground utility infrastructure
			 of the United States, including pipelines, electric, gas, telecommunications,
			 water, sewer, and cable television lines, is jeopardized by unintentional
			 damage caused by those who fail to have underground lines located prior to
			 digging;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to establish a
			 3-digit, nationwide, toll-free number to be used by State

quote.#tail:
systems to provide information on underground utility
			 lines;

text.#text:
Whereas the 1,600 members of the Common Ground Alliance,
			 who are dedicated to ensuring public safety, environmental protection, and the
			 integrity of services, promote the national

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Pipeline Safety, Regulatory Certainty, and Job
			 Creation Act of 2011
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Pipeline Safety, Regulatory Certainty, and Job Creation Act of 2011

quote.#tail:
program
			 by eliminating the exemptions from notifying

centers
			 before digging that were formerly given to local and State government agencies
			 and their contractors; and

to increase awareness of safe
			 digging practices across the United States and to celebrate the anniversary of
			 811, the national

text.#text: Whereas the Common Ground Alliance has designated April as
